com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.socket.test

Class SocketClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.socket.test.SocketClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class SocketClient
extends Thread
    This is an example socket adapter client. It can be used to communicate with the Catalys Server over a simple TCP/IP socket.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SocketClient

        public SocketClient(String hostname,
                    int port,
                    boolean ack,
                    String[] targets)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        hostname - the hostname where the socket adapter is running.
        port - the port on which the socket adapter is listening.
        ack - whether or not to use acks for each message.
        targets - desired message destinations.

    • Method Detail

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Find out if the client is connected to the server.
        Returns:
        true if the client is connected to the server, false otherwise.

      • run

        public void run()
        Run the thread loop that reconnects the client to the socket adapter and reads messages from it.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class Thread

      • createMessage

        Crate a new message to send.

        Returns:
        a new message to send.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(String target)
                 throws Exception
        Send a message a given FIX session.
        Parameters:
        target - the name of the destination session.
        Throws:
        Exception - if there is a problem sending the message.

      • sendMessages

        public void sendMessages()
                  throws Exception
        Send messages a to all targets.
        Throws:
        Exception - if there is a problem sending the message.

      • sendContinuousMessages

        public void sendContinuousMessages()
        Send a message to each target every 10 seconds.
